dct_description_sm:
Appears in: A Modern Atlas, from the Lates and Best Authorities, Exhibiting the Various
        Divisions of the World with its chief Empires, Kingdoms, and States; in Sixty Maps,
        carefully reduced from the Larges and Most Authentic Sources. 1818, Philadelphia, Thomas
        Dobson Edition.

Much of the geography proves to be inaccurate due to the fact it was based on
        antiquarian maps. "Large tracts of the interior of Africa are marked unknown". Across the
        top: Pinkerton's Modern Atlas.
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Dr. Oscar I. Norwich collection of maps of Africa and its islands, 1486 - ca. 1865 courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
